Reviews.Content: Great value hotel, quiet area close to town This hotel is excellent value and in a great location.Set in a quiet neighbourhood close to the river, it's a pleasent 15 minute stroll in to town or a short bus ride.The rooms are typical 3 star: very comfy and clean.The staff were very friendly and kind. If you are looking for a great value hotel and a good nights sleep, then this is the place!
Reviews.Author: BAEdinburgh

Reviews.Content: Good option for Florence hotel My wife and I spent two night in this nice hotel.We prefer that the hotel will be placed out side the city center and will have a close public transportation ability. This is exactly what we got in Liberty hotel. It is 15 minutes bus drive from the city center and it takes 5 minutes walking to get to the bus station (the bus arrives once in 10 minutes or so). The room was nice, the breakfast was OK as well.The price was fair (99 Euro per night + 15 Euro per night for car parking).The most impressive part of this hotel is the service level of the staff. They were welcoming and very helpful. They have pointed us exactly to the highlights that should be seen in Florence in two days time.
Reviews.Author: dror2311

Reviews.Content: Generally a pleasant stay Staying in Liberty Hotel was generally a pleasant experience, but I have to highlight some points. Something I didn't like was that during our staying there for 3 days, nobody came to change sheets and towels. In addition, they had told us that the hotel offers bicycles for free, as the centre is a bit far if you don't like walking, but the bicycles were damaged.Finally, the staff were generally friendly and helpful and the breakfast was not very big but it had a variety of products.
Reviews.Author: Christina83

Reviews.Content: Beautiful Location walking distance from Ponte Vecchio Hotel Liberty is in a beautiful neighborhood about a mile from the Ponte Vecchio. We arrived by rental car and parking was 15鈧?extra per night. At first there was a mix up with our room reservation 鈥?the desk manager gave us a double instead of a triple; however, he soon remedied this. Unfortunately, the triple did not have the lovely view of the grounds that the double had. In fact, it had no view but did have a nice balcony. The room was large, clean and comfortable with plenty of storage. The bath too was large with a good shower and plenty of towels. One thing I noted throughout Italy was the standard hair dryers provided in all of the hotels in which we stayed; they were, without a doubt, the worst I have ever used. The breakfast at the hotel was very nice 鈥?standard continental. The one drawback was the lack of restaurants nearby. We did find a wonderful trattoria not far from the hotel but it was not open every evening. The hotel staff was friendly and courteous. I would definitely consider staying at this hotel if in Florence again.
Reviews.Author: Lucytwo259

Reviews.Content: Quiet location, good quality hotel Staff of the hotel was nice and war. We felt very comfortable and well looked after, so we could relax during 3 days of our stay in the middle of our trip across Northern Italy. We will definitely recommend this Hotel to our friends. Thank you.
Reviews.Author: Sveta_Michael

Reviews.Content: Wonderful stay We stayed for four nights at the hotel villa liberty when we were in florence the second week of june. We did a booking through their website and got a special offer 4x3. We appreciated that.The hotel was 15 minutes far from piazza michelangiolo and same distance to santa croce church. Also nice church is san miniato al monte near piazza michelangiolo. We reccomend this to everyone. From there you have the wonderful view of Florence in front of you.The hotel is a very nice villa with a nice garden from behind. The hotel villa liberty had a private parking, the only thing we had to leave the keys at the front desk.The room was too spacious, furnished with liberty style. We also found a well- working air conditioning. That is very important when you go somewhere and it is too hot.The breakfast type was continental. There was various choices; salumi, cheese, different types of briosches , fresh fruits, american coffee etc. The staff was very helpful and they were very polite. Rare thing to find the staff paying attention to you when you do the check-in or ask for some information. We had a nice stay in Florence and I think the nicest hotel we could find there. The quality price is a deal in hotel villa liberty.We will go back there if we visit Florence again.
Reviews.Author: irvinemich

Reviews.Content: Loved the villa Great place, helpful staff, minutes from center of florence.
Reviews.Author: celtic08

Reviews.Content: Great Place to Stay in Florence!       Room 15
Reviews.Author: C.Parsley

Reviews.Content: would stay again This was our last stop on a ten day visit to Italy. We had travelled from Venice and were delighted with the hotel. It was full of character with a good size bedroom with a beautiful mural painted on the ceiling , comfortable beds and nice and clean. The portable telly bolted to the wall was the only ugly thing in the room, which looked rather out of place. A safe in the room was a useful bonus. The bathroom came complete with bath and loads of hot water which was essential after a day marching around beautiful Florence!The only moan was the breakfast, which was extremely average - it seemed to be impossible to get a hot coffee and the toaster was on the blink.However the hotel was nicely tucked away from the city tourists and traffic and was close to the bus stops for transport into the city...although the buses stop before midnight so we often walked back to the hotel, which didn't take long.
Reviews.Author: ianedin

Reviews.Content: Away from the tourist crowds The hotel is located 20 - 30 minutes walk from the central attractions - a pleasant stroll down the banks of the river Arno. Bus stop 300 meters away at the the bottom of the hill if needed - No.23 for the railway station (tickets 4.5Eu for 4 trips). Next door to the bus stop an excellent deli where you can enjoy quality food and wine for a few euros while you sit and salivate over the wonderful selection. The hotel rooms are comfortable traditional art deco style - very clean with a good bathroom  powerful shower. The breakfast is adequate to get you going of a morning. The hotel staff speak good English and are helpful. The hotel is in a nice resedential area - quiet at night (very safe). The 109 euro per night for a couple incl. breakfast seems reasonable compared to hotels in the city. I would not recommend staying near the main railway station if you are in Florence for a few days - too noisey and too many people. All in all I would recommend the hotel - Florence is a walkable city. Take a half day trip to Fiesole for wonderful views of the city - there is a regular service bus No.7 from the centre. General costs of food/drink are as per the UK if not pricier - certainly in the tourist trap areas. If you veer of down side streets your Euro will go a lot further. If you are in Florence four days or more have a day in Sienna - a contrast to Firenze less traffic and more quaint.
Reviews.Author: Bankrobber

Reviews.Content: New Owners Are Great Ignore the earlier reviews that gave this hotel bad ratings. They stayed before the new owners took over. For a 2 star hotel, this is a great little hotel. It is a little far from the tourist area, but it is a nice walk, or a short bus ride. The staff were EXTREMELY helpful and very easy to communicate and deal with. I was pleasantly surprised to have free wi-fi. You had to go to the lobby or breakfast room to get the signal, but once there is had a great connection. We had two rooms and both were clean and nice.
Reviews.Author: Cubfanincs

Reviews.Content: Nice Hotel We actually booked a room at the Residence Michelangiolo, but due to a water leak, were sent over to the Hotel Liberty down the street. I'm not sure of the room value because we were given the same rate promised at the other location--which seemed to be a good value ($140 usd per night).Our room was very nice with a full-size bed and a second room with two single beds. The room had air-conditioning but it was fixed so you could not adjust...either on or off. (The on-setting wasn't very high, so you need to let it run all day.)The service at the front desk was very nice and they even made a reservation for an Ufizi tour with no waiting in line. It is about a 20 minute walk into the center of Florence and the attractions. Breakfast was mediocre. They had a small buffet table with a few pastries and yogurt. Coffee was available, but only if the woman serving would acknowledge you. She seemed to only be interested in serving the business men. The front desk offered some dining recommendations.The Gigi Trattoria was a nice family restaurant (within walking distance) with authentic Italian food. We enjoyed dinner there the first night. They also suggested Portofino Restaurant for a fancier dinner. (Will need to take a taxi.) We tried that the second night. It was pretty good, a little more expensive and seemed to have more locals. You'll need to study your Italian for this restaurant!
Reviews.Author: 2wicky

Reviews.Content: the best place I have been in Italy The hotel is really loving, the staff speaks perfectly english and they have been very helpful with us . The location is perfect, away from the terrible traffic of the city but at only a few minutes walk from the Ponte Vecchio. Once I will have the possibility return to Florence I will definitively go back in Hotel Liberty
Reviews.Author: stevenMilano

Reviews.Content: Shady retreat in a green leafy neighborhood Staying in this beautiful building away from the fray restored us for another day of sightseeing. The rooms and garden are not spacious enough to make this a hotel where you want to linger for hours. It is a very clean hotel with interesting furniture and nice firm beds.Within 15 minute scenic walk to Piazzale Michelangelo and the elegant restaurant la Loggia. Within ten minute walk of the cozy trattoria Da Beppino. Within 20-25 minute walk of the Uffizi.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Terrible My husband and I had booked a double room for our last night in Italy - upon arrival we were told the room had gone even though I had an e-mail printout confirming the reservation under credit card guarantee. We were offered a single room instead which was the size of a shoe-box, one towel which resembled a cotton tea-towel. As it was a busy time of the year we had no choice but accept the box room. Hotel resembled Fawlty Towers - wish we'd read your reviews before committing to the worst night in a hotel during 30 years' travelling!
Reviews.Author: Weddox

Reviews.Content: dont judge a book by its cover The location is great as said before. The hotel looks appealing however once inside the rooms fall short of adequate. Bathroom stunk of smoke seeping through the cracks. Bath towels were actually bed sheets. Mosquitoes were rife and we were bitten all over (or were they fleas?). We did find staff amiable and they tried hard at breakfast. I guess you could say that it was adequate but overpriced for what it was.
Reviews.Author: RacheleAustralia

Reviews.Content: Great value and location I was quite pleased with this hotel. The location was great, and our room was clean and spacious, with a large terrace overlooking the street.Unlike one of the other reviewers, I found the staff quite helpful. We needed a pharmacy open on a Sunday, and they found us one, and they recommended a great restaurant down the street. The price was reasonable, and I'd return in a heartbeat.
Reviews.Author: loriw1a

Reviews.Content: Disco at Breakfast Was Unexpected! The Villa Liberty is an excellent location in Florence, within walking distance of the River, and an easy stroll into town. However, the staff did not seem very tuned in to their city, places to eat, or what to do. When I asked the front desk clerk, where do you eat in this city, she replied, home. Wrong answer for a tired, hungry tourist just arriving and in need of a good meal!The room had old lineoleum, but the wooden ceiling and beams gave it a warm feeling of the days of old. The bathroom was completely tiled, which was also a nice old fashioned touch. There was a heat wave when we were there in late May, and the air conditioner did not work. When we called downstairs, they said the government has to issue the okay to turn it on! Well, not much can be done in that situation.On waking up and going in to their breakfast room, my husband and I were shocked that an ederly gentlemen that doubled as the front desk clerk, had blarring disco music piped into the room! Not exactly what you'd expect from a boutique hotel...so amid the boom boom of disco beat, we tried to concentrate on drinking our coffee and having a lite bite to eat.If you are on a budget, the best thing I could say about this hotel is its location, and the nearby little neighborhood restaurants, that were terrific.If you are looking for an attentive staff, this is not the place for you. As a seasoned and independent traveler - it's a good jumping off point for all the activities in town.R.E. SilvaOakland, Calif.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Sense of Humour Needed I can remember the dead mosquitos which had been squashed on the wall added to the general ambiance of the place. The hotel itself was nice. The Management was not.The air conditioning was hardly ever switched on. The blurb on the hotel web site indicated that they would be only too pleased to assist in any way they could - we did not find this. We asked about booking a sight seeing trip and were told to get a brochure and phone up about it. Management was generally unpleasantWe referred to the hotel as The Stalag.
Reviews.Author: Desertblossom

Reviews.Content: Not so charming hotel in Florence My wife and I just returned from two weeks of touring Italy, this our second visit. We like to stay at nice, clean and fresh hotels, 3 or 4 star. The Villa Liberty was physically the above, but unfortunately the owners who run the hotel spoiled our experience. They advertised as having air conditioning, however were reluctant to turn it on in hot, humid Florence. We had to phone the front desk in order for the central air conditioning to be put on. They disagreed with us that it was necessary to turn it on at all, but when we persisted, they agreed. However, in the middle of the night the air conditioning would be turned off. There was also a feeling of mistrust from the front desk as they refused to return our passports to us until we checked out. This is not a youth hostel, but a 3-star hotel costing 170 euros per night. As well, they had our credit card as a guarantee of payment. I would only return if they changed management.
Reviews.Author: lass=
